Kirk Creek Campground is a great spot! I'm glad you had a wonderful experience. Based on your preference for campsites with scenic views of lakes or rivers, I've filtered the list to show you some amazing options:

1. **Pinecrest Lake Campground** (5,600 ft) in Stanislaus National Forest: This campground offers scenic views of Pinecrest Lake and is surrounded by the Sierra Nevada mountains. Hike to the nearby Pinecrest Peak or explore the Emigrant Wilderness.
2. **Bucks Lake Campground** (5,200 ft) in Plumas National Forest: This campground is situated on the shores of Bucks Lake and offers scenic views of the surrounding mountains. Hike to the nearby Buck's Lake Trail or explore the Plumas National Forest.
3. **Lake Alpine Campground** (7,300 ft) in Stanislaus National Forest: This campground is situated on the shores of Lake Alpine and offers scenic views of the surrounding Sierra Nevada mountains. Hike to the nearby Lake Alpine Trail or explore the Stanislaus National Forest.
4. **Carson Pass Campground** (7,800 ft) in Eldorado National Forest: This campground offers scenic views of Caples Lake and is surrounded by the Sierra Nevada mountains. Hike to the nearby Carson Pass Trail or explore the Eldorado National Forest.
5. **Convict Lake Campground** (7,850 ft) in Inyo National Forest: This campground is situated on the shores of Convict Lake and offers scenic views of the surrounding Sierra Nevada mountains. Hike to the nearby Convict Lake Trail or explore the Inyo National Forest.

These campsites offer stunning views of lakes, and some of them are located at higher elevations, which might appeal to your experience camping near lakes. Keep in mind that some of these campsites may have limited amenities, so be sure to check the campsite's website or contact the park directly for more information.
